data.title: Meet the Leadership Team
data.meta_description: Headquartered in Herndon, Virginia, SCORE has a leadership team that supports the field organization. Meet our staff leaders and board of directors below.
data.text:
Bridget Weston

CEO

Bridget Weston, CEO of SCORE, a partner of the U.S. Small Business Administration, leads a network of 10,000 volunteers providing free mentoring and education to small business owners. Bridget, a thought leader, appears on CNN, MSNBC and Bloomberg. She has a Bachelor of Economics from Wharton and an MBA from Temple University.

Amanda Capozio

Vice President of Technology

Amanda Capozio is the Vice President of Technology for SCORE and is responsible for all aspects of the organization’s information technology and systems. She provides vision and leadership for technology initiatives that advance the mission of SCORE.

Betsy Dougert

Vice President of External Relations

Betsy Dougert is the VP of External Relations for SCORE, overseeing national public relations, government relations and sponsors. With 10 years in marketing and communications, she has a master's in strategic communications from Villanova and a bachelor's from William and Mary.

Candice Stennett

Vice President of Marketing

Candice Stennett is the VP of Marketing at SCORE, leading teams in digital marketing, advertising, branding and field enablement. She optimizes SCORE's marketing funnel and holds an MBA and a bachelor's in marketing and international business from Indiana University of Pennsylvania.

Rick Peluso

Vice President of Finance

Rick Peluso is the VP of Finance for SCORE, leading the accounting team with over 20 years of non-profit experience. He specializes in modernizing financial operations. Rick holds a bachelor's from the University of Maryland and an MBA from Hood College.

Tracy Shaw

Chair of the Board

Tracy Shaw, from Southbury, Conn., heads client engagement strategy at Equitable with 30 years in business development across various industries. She is vice-chair of the Immune Deficiency Foundation, holds an MBA from Western Connecticut State University, is a doctoral candidate at Adler University and has a patent for 401kSecure.

Julie Poland

Vice Chair

Julie Poland is a speaker, author and 7 Attributes of Agile Growth Certified Coach. Since 1990, she has provided processes and structures for business leaders to transform their organizations and achieve improved results and sustainable growth.

Jayne Lerman

Secretary

Jayne Lerman is a tech leader with experience at Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs and Mastercard. Known for transforming global functions and enhancing digital environments, she is now a startup advisor, board member for Destination Imagination and Executive in Residence for Progress Partners. Jayne also advises the Equal Learning Fund.

Judy Treviño

Treasurer

Judy Treviño, Executive Director for CCVI Ministries, Inc. (Christus Health), has over 20 years of experience in business administration, finance, HR and IT. She excels in strategic planning, governance training, recruitment and fundraising in nonprofit, governmental and foundation sectors.

Mukesh Asarpota

Mukesh Asarpota, Director of Business Platforms at Orchard Therapeutics, is a business technology leader known for strategic vision, global team-building and business solutions development. He holds an MS in Computer Science from the University of Massachusetts and a CIO Leadership certification from MIT Sloan.

Kelly Bingel

Kelly Bingel, an entrepreneur and lobbyist, has decades of Capitol Hill experience, including serving as a former U.S. Senate chief of staff. She launched Dynamic Gymnastics in 2013 after investing in several D.C. small businesses. Kelly began her career at The Tulsa Tribune, was inducted into Phi Beta Kappa at LSU, earned a JD from Georgetown and is a member of the Virginia Bar Association.

Rick Brimacomb

Rick Brimacomb, founder of Brimacomb & Associates, advises and invests in emerging companies. He also manages Club E, a networking group. Previously, he co-founded Sherpa Partners and worked in venture capital and investment banking.

Ricardo Casas

Ricardo Casas, a SCORE volunteer for over seven years, serves as Associate District Director for Southeast Florida. He led global businesses at ExxonMobil for 20+ years. Ricardo holds degrees from Georgia Tech and Thunderbird.

Julie Christiansen

Julie Christiansen, CEO of Gordon Laboratories, has led consumer goods and manufacturing at Dean Foods, Minnetonka Brands and Cristophe Hair Care. She holds an MBA from Capella University and a BA from St. Norbert College.

Scott Harkins

Scott Harkins is SVP of Global Portfolio Marketing for FedEx Services, overseeing global digital, customer experience, products and talent development. He joined FedEx in 1992. Scott holds a BS from Notre Dame and an MS from Georgia Tech.

Frank Klisanich

Frank Klisanich is a business leader who expanded ConAgra Foods Snacks Group into 70+ countries and served as CEO at The Village Company. Now a consultant and adjunct instructor, he holds an economics degree from the University of Western Ontario and an MBA from Queen’s University.

Pat Loftus

Pat Loftus, a New World Angels member, has 35+ years in corporate leadership and six years in small business. She advises startups and volunteers in entrepreneurship. Pat holds degrees from Penn State and Carnegie Mellon, in addition to an MBA from the University of Pittsburgh.

Bob Manza

Bob Manza, retired from PepsiCo in 2018, held senior VP and CFO roles in Canada and Mexico. He is a SCORE mentor and volunteers with Foundation Communities in Austin. Bob holds a BBA from the University of Michigan and an MBA from the University of Detroit Mercy.

John A. McCloskey

John McCloskey, a SCORE volunteer for 10 years, served as Chapter Chair and District Director in North Carolina. He was on management boards for FAG Bearings and Schaeffler AG and was CEO of the Aerospace Group. He holds degrees in engineering and business, with post-grad work at Harvard, London Business School and IMI Geneva.

Nik Shah

Nik Shah, a Partner with PwC in Washington, D.C., leads Workforce Transformation and the People Analytics team. He helps multinational companies with data-driven workforce strategies. Previously, he was the HR leader for a $4B division with 11,000 employees and 150 HR practitioners.

Steve R. Smith

After 40+ years with IBM and nine years with SCORE, Steve has vast experience in business entrepreneurship. He led IBM’s go-to-market strategies globally. At SCORE, he chaired the Fairfield chapter from 2019-2022. Steve lives in Westport, CT and NYC.

David Zechman

David Zechman, a seasoned healthcare executive with 20+ years of experience, now leads The Zechman Group. He is an author, speaker, coach and consultant. He holds degrees from Miami University and Cleveland State University and is a fellow in the American College of Healthcare Administration.

Liz Sara

President of the SCORE Foundation

Liz Sara, President of the SCORE Foundation, oversees sponsorships and giving strategies. Former Chair of the Dingman Center and National Women's Business Council, she advises on entrepreneurship and supports women business owners.

Jim Cohen

Vice President of Sponsorship

Jim has over 20 years of experience in events and sponsorships. He led global conference teams, working with Fortune 500 companies. Awarded Show Manager of the Year in 2007, he innovates in events technology. Jim holds a Policy and Economics degree from Syracuse University and loves travel and the Green Mountains of Vermont.
